title: Godot (GDScript)
description: A robust Godot Engine cheatsheet focused on GDScript and practical engine workflows: project structure, nodes/scenes, signals, input, resources, file I/O, HTTP/JSON, debugging, exporting, and core language features.

categories.title: Basic Functionality
categories.description: GDScript basics: types, variables, strings, null, printing.

items.title: Variables, types, and casting
items.description: GDScript supports optional typing (recommended for larger projects).
items.example:
extends Node

const SPEED := 200.0
var hp: int = 100

func _ready():
	print("hp=", hp, " speed=", SPEED)

items.title: Strings
items.description: Formatting with % is common; many helpers are on String.
items.example:
var name := "World"
print("Hello %s" % name)

items.title: Printing, warnings, errors
items.description: Prefer push_warning/push_error for editor-visible messages.
items.example:
print_debug("loading...")
assert(1 + 1 == 2)
push_warning("careful")

items.title: Autoload (singleton)
items.description: Project Settings → Autoload to register a script/scene as a global singleton.

rows: Use for global state/services (save system, config).
Use the autoload name as a global, e.g. SaveGame.save()
Autoloads load before the first scene.

items.example:
# If you autoload scripts/save_game.gd as SaveGame
SaveGame.save()

items.title: load vs preload
items.description: preload is compile-time (fast at runtime); load is runtime (can fail).

categories.title: Common Errors
categories.description: Frequent runtime/editor errors and what they usually mean.

items.title: Null instance / invalid get index
items.description: Often caused by missing nodes, wrong node paths, or using a node before it exists.

rows: Check that the variable/node isn’t null before accessing it.
Verify the path and scene structure; prefer @onready bindings.
Attempt to call function on a null instance
Guard with if obj != null, or fix initialization order.

items.title: Freed instance / invalid call
items.description: Happens when you keep a reference after queue_free().

rows: Don’t use a node after queue_free(); check is_instance_valid(node).
Check method name, node type, and that the script is attached.
Ensure your callback parameters match the signal.

items.example:
if is_instance_valid(enemy):
	enemy.queue_free()

items.title: Autoload not found
items.description: A global name isn’t defined unless you added it as an Autoload.

rows: Add script/scene in Project Settings → Autoload.

items.example: # Project Settings → Autoload: add scripts/save_game.gd as SaveGame
